stem: Which of the following is considered a pure substance from a scientific point of view?
rationale: A pure substance consists of a single type of particle. Milk, salt, and ghee are all mixtures of different substances, while distilled water is a pure substance.

stem: What is the key characteristic of a homogeneous mixture?
options: It has a uniform composition throughout.
Its components can be seen with the naked eye.
rationale: A homogeneous mixture, or solution, has a uniform composition throughout.

stem: A mixture of oil and water is an example of a(n):
rationale: Oil and water do not mix uniformly and have physically distinct parts, making them a heterogeneous mixture.

stem: An alloy is considered a mixture because it:
options: Cannot be separated by physical methods.
Shows the properties of its constituents and can have variable composition.
Is composed of a single element.
rationale: Although an alloy is a mixture of metals that cannot be separated by physical methods, it is considered a mixture because it shows the properties of its constituent metals and can have a variable composition.

stem: Which of the following describes a substance?
options: It contains more than one pure substance.
It is a mixture of different particles.
It consists of a single type of particle.
rationale: A substance is a pure single form of matter that consists of a single type of particle.
